description.narrative: To further the informational exchange with partner nations by reinforcing inspectional techniques and methodologies with counterpart law enforcement agencies in the host nations own operating environment. Skills previously presented in the US during IBIT by conducting practical exercise at critical port(s) of entry identified by host national. The goal of this program is to help build an internal train-the-trainer capacity and eventually infuse the curriculum into the formal training regimen of the host nation.

participating-org.narrative: U.S. Government - Department of Homeland Security

description.narrative: Border security assessments are intended to provide CBP-INA, U.S. State Department and our in-country advisors with information on the current stat of border and cargo security within the applicable foreign country.

description.narrative: These on-site advisors provide technical assistance in a variety of areas such as: targeting and risk management, selectivity, duty collection, appraisement, classification, cargo inspection, passenger inspection, high-tech equipment, general management, integrity programs, canine enforcement, smuggling, information collection and analysis, and legal/regulatory considerations.
